name: Atar
subtitle: Yazata of Fire
description:
Atar stands as one of the most righteous and powerful figures in Persian mythology. Known as "Yazata of Fire", this epithet captures the essence of their divine nature. 

According to Persian sacred texts, Atar's origins reflect the eternal struggle between truth (Asha) and falsehood (Druj) The worship of Atar became central to Persian religious practice, with devotees seeking their favor through fire temple ceremonies, ethical conduct, and ritual purity. 

The mythology surrounding Atar reveals deep insights into Persian worldview, particularly concerning unknown and humanity's relationship with the divine. 

The legacy of Atar extends far beyond ancient Persian civilization. Atar's dualistic theology influenced later monotheistic religions. The ancient wisdom traditions continue to inspire modern Zoroastrian communities Scholars continue to study Atar's mythology for its profound insights into Persian culture, religion, and philosophy.
